resources.string: NOTE : If you encounter any bugs, you can send me an e-mail to report it. Thank you for your interest.

0. DISCLAIMER"
"

This application is not created for any purpose other than to control and regulate the communication" "between the terminal and the emulated card by authorized programmers." "

No liability will be accepted for any other use. "
"

1. WHAT IS NFC CARD EMULATOR AND WHAT IS IT USED FOR ?"
"

NFC Card Emulator" "application is an application created for testing purposes and uses the Host-Based Card Emulation method." "

With this application, it can be checked whether the system is working as desired by emulating a contactless card and" "controlling the communication between the terminals."
"

2. SCREEN AND BUTTONS"
"

This application consists of 4 different screens." "

These are the main screen, the file management screen, the help screen, and the about screen."
"

The Main Screen"
"

At the top of the main screen is a description of the service status and the selected file. There are two buttons under these explanation texts." "

The button on the left is the button that starts and stops the HCE service. If no file is selected, this button is grayed out." "

The button on the right is the file management button. Using this button, you can import files and any of the imported files can be selected to be used in the HCE service."
"

The File Management Screen"
"

There are two main headings on the file management screen. These are: File Selection, Add new file." "

There are two different buttons under the Add new file heading. These are: Browse and Import." "

The Browse button starts an activity to select a file and the user can select a file with txt extension from any different path (Please see the 5th heading to find out what features the selected file should have)." "

Import button imports the file selected by the user into the application files. If there is no file selected, this button is grayed out."
"

The Help Screen"
"

It is the screen consisting of written information to inform the user about the application. You are on this screen right now."
"

The About Screen"
"

This is the screen that gives information about the developer and source code of the application."
"

3. HOW DOES THE APPLICATION WORK ?"
"

The application expects the user to import a txt file in the appropriate format for apdu communication (see the titles 4, 5 and 6 for details)." "

All imported txt files can be seen in the spinner under the "File Selection" title under the "Manage File" screen." "

The user should select the desired txt file with the spinner and press the "Use Selected File" button. Thus the selected file will be used by the HCE service." "

After selecting the file, return to the main screen and click the "Start Service" button. The application now emulates the card specified with the txt file." "

When you bring your device closer to the target terminal (This distance should be maximum 4 cm.) The communication between the terminal and the card will appear on the main screen under "Communication Logs"."
"

4. HOW TO IMPORT FILE(s) ?"
"

There is a "Manage File" button on the main screen of the application. This button navigates to the user file management screen." "

On this screen, there are "Browse" and "Import" buttons under the "Add New File" heading." "

In the first stage, the "Import" button is inactive and appears in gray. The user must first press the "Browse" button to select a file." "

After the file selection is complete, the "Import" button becomes active and turns blue. If the "Import" button is clicked, the file will be imported."
"

5. WHAT FORMAT SHOULD THE IMPORTED FILE BE ?"
"

By default, the application only allows txt format to be browsed. Thus, all the imported files will be in txt format."
"

6. WHAT SHOULD THE CONTENT OF THE IMPORTED FILE BE ?"
"

The files must contain an equal number of command APDUs and response APDUs." "

Command APDU should be in the first line and response APDU should be in the other line. Thus, the Application can know which response will be given for which command." "

C-APDU keywords are used for command APDU and "R-APDU" keywords are used for response APDU." "

Please review the example below."
"

		C-APDU:00A4001234567
" "		R-APDU:9000
" "		…
" "		C-APDU:00B200987654321
" "		R-APDU:6A82
"
"

7. HOW TO EMULATE THE CARD WITH THE IMPORTED FILE ?"
"

On the Manage File screen, there is the title "File Selection". Under this heading, there is a spinner for imported files." "

The user selects the desired file with the spinner and presses the "Use Selected File" button. Thus, the file is made available for" "use by the HCE service. Whenever the user presses the "Start Service" button on the main screen, the service will run with the selected file."
"

NOTE:" "A new file can be selected while the service is active."
"

8. HOW TO START THE HOST BASED CARD EMULATION SERVICE ?"
"

For this process, there is a special button called "Start Service" on the main screen. This button is initially grayed out" "because no file has been selected yet. After selecting File, this button becomes active and turns blue." "

The service becomes active when the user presses the button."
"

9. HOW TO STOP THE HOST BASED CARD EMULATION SERVICE ?"
"

By default, the service is not started. That's why the "Start Service" button appears on the main screen. If the user has started" "the service, the same button will appear in a different form as "Stop Service". It is enough to press this button to stop the service." "

In other words, the same button is used to start the service when the service is stopped and to stop the service when it is started."
"

10. SENDING LOGS BY EMAIL"
"

The application follows the steps of the user, important events and records them as log messages."
"

These log messages can be shared with the circular email button located in the lower right corner of the application" "and visible on each different screen." "After sharing, the user can preferably clear the log messages with the pop-up dialog box."
"
